means: 耍滑不做，逃避（应做的事等）

sentence.Network_en: He clutched the child tightly as she again tried to wriggle free.
sentence.Network_cn: 孩子一扭一扭地又想挣脱，他紧紧地抓住了她。

sentence.Network_en: I've got an appointment I can't wriggle out of.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有个推脱不掉的约会.

sentence.Network_en: Don't let Tom wriggle out of helping you.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要让汤姆借故不帮你.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Middle Low German wriggelen, frequentative of wriggen 'twist, turn'

entry.tran: 蠕动，扭动(身体的一部分)
entry.def: If you wriggle or wriggle part of your body, you twist and turn with quick movements, for example because you are uncomfortable.

example.ex: The babies are wriggling on their tummies...
They were fidgeting and wriggling in their seats...
example.tran: 他们在座位上焦躁不安，扭来扭去。

entry.tran: 扭动着行进;蠕动着行进
entry.def: If you wriggle somewhere, for example through a small gap, you move there by twisting and turning your body.

example.ex: He clutched the child tightly as she again tried to wriggle free...
example.tran: 孩子一扭一扭地又想挣脱，他紧紧地抓住了她。

example.ex: Bauman wriggled into the damp coverall.
example.tran: 鲍曼扭着身子穿上潮湿的工作服。

means.word_mean: 1. to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling);

sentences.sentence: "The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace"

sentences.en: He wriggled uncomfortably on the chair.
sentences.cn: 他坐在椅子上不舒服地扭动着身体。
